{{Infobox AFL season | year = 1997 | image = | imagesize = 100px | caption = AFL logo 1990-1999 | teams = 16 | premiers = {{AFL Ade}} | count = 1 | minor premiers = {{AFL StK}} | mpcount = 2 | national cup winners = {{AFL Car}} | nccount = 1 | matches = 185 | attendance = | highattend = 98,828 - Grand Final
{{AFL StK}} v {{AFL Ade}} | top goal scorer = [[Tony Modra]] ({{AFL Ade}}) | brownlow medallist = [[Robert Harvey (footballer)|Robert Harvey]] ({{AFL StK}}) | prevseason = [[1996 AFL season|1996]] | nextseason = [[1998 AFL season|1998]] }} Results and statistics for the '''[[Australian Football League]] season of 1997'''. The [[Port Adelaide Power]] joined the competition. The [[Brisbane Lions]] also joined the competition after the merger of the {{AFL BB}} and {{AFL Fit}}. Before the start of the 1997 season, {{AFL Foo}} changed its name to the Western Bulldogs Football Club. ==Premiership season== ===Round 1=== {{start box}} |- bgcolor="#CCCCFF" | '''Home team''' | Last Season !! +/- |- | MCG || 53 || 43,488 || 83,271 || 13,392 || 2304,865 || 46,114 || - 2626 |- | Football Park || 22 || 38,001 || 47,256 || 31,757 || 836,020 || 39,428 || - 1427 |- | SCG || 11 || 35,818 || 46,168 || 23,598 || 393,999 || 24,574 || + 11,244 |- | Waverley Park || 22 || 33,806 || 54,699 || 15,939 || 743,732 || 25,545 || + 8261 |- | Subiaco Oval || 17 || 28,371 || 39,711 || 14,721 || 482,310 || 28,289 || + 82 |- | Whitten Oval || 1 || 26,704 || 26,704 || 26,704 || 26,704 || 10,482 || + 16,222 |- | Victoria Park || 3 || 24,473 || 25,323 || 23,433 || 73,419 || 23,581 || + 892 |- | WACA || 5 || 23,578 || 29,838 || 18,198 || 117,892 || 25,253 || - 1675 |- | Kardinia Park || 9 || 21,269 || 24,099 || 16,467 || 191,417 || 22,670 || - 1401 |- | Optus Oval || 22 || 20,781 || 34,922 || 8664 || 457,182 || 15,641 || + 5140 |- | Gabba || 11 || 19,550 || 21,348 || 17,123 || 215,051 || 18,088 || + 1462 |- | Totals || 176 || 33,197 || 83,271 || 8664 || 5842,591 || 29,637 || + 3560 |} ==Notable events== *Defending premiers {{AFL Nor}} were the lowest ranked team in the top eight to reach a preliminary final, when it went down to minor premiers {{AFL StK}}. It currently stands as the only time in VFL/AFL history a team has made the preliminary finals outside the top six. *In its first season as a merged entity the {{AFL BL}} finished in the top eight, but it went down to minor premiers {{AFL StK}} in the first week of the finals. *{{AFL Mel}} became the first wooden-spooner to win their first and last games of the season. ==References== * [http://stats.rleague.com/afl/seas/1997.html 1997 Season - AFL Tables] ==See also== * [[1997 AFL Grand Final]] {{VFL/AFL seasons}} [[Category:1997 in Australian rules football|AFL season]] [[Category:Australian Football League seasons]]
